snippet: Real estate upstarts like Fundrise are allowing people to invest in their neighborhoods in a way that has traditionally been the exclusive domain of wealthy investors and private equity firms.
abstract: Real estate upstarts like Fundrise, Property Peers, Realty Mogul and Prodigy Network are using so-called crowdfunding techniques to transform how real estate projects are built; trend allows people to invest in their neighborhoods in ways that have traditionally been exclusive domain of wealthy investors and private equity firms.
lead_paragraph: Real estate upstarts like Fundrise are allowing people to invest in their neighborhoods in a way that has traditionally been the exclusive domain of wealthy investors and private equity firms.

headline.seo: Washington Projects Invite the Small Local Investor
headline.main: Washington Projects Invite the Small Local Investor
headline.print_headline: In Washington, Inviting a Crowd to Invest in Properties
